metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3248 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.Description:
Untrusted search path vulnerability in Puppet Enterprise 2.8 before 2.8.7, Puppet before 2.7.26 and 3.x before 3.6.2, Facter 1.6.x and 2.x before 2.0.2, Hiera before 1.3.4, and Mcollective before 2.5.2, when running with Ruby 1.9.1 or earlier, allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse file in the current working directory, as demonstrated using (1) rubygems/defaults/operating_system.rb, (2) Win32API.rb, (3) Win32API.so, (4) safe_yaml.rb, (5) safe_yaml/deep.rb, or (6) safe_yaml/deep.so; or (7) operatingsystem.rb, (8) operatingsystem.so, (9) osfamily.rb, or (10) osfamily.so in puppet/confine.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2014-3248` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

facter - 2.0.1-1ubuntu1
libfacter3.14.12 - 2.0.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

mcollective - 2.5.2+dfsg-1
mcollective-client - 2.5.2+dfsg-1
mcollective-common - 2.5.2+dfsg-1
No subscription required

puppet - 3.8.5-2
puppet-master - 3.8.5-2
puppet-master-passenger - 3.8.5-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: facter package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.1-1ubuntu1').
mcollective package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.5.2+dfsg-1').
puppet package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.5-2').
